content:

Feature Overviewüá∫üá∏ Integrated Claims with Claim.MD
US Insurance Billing Additional Resources
üá∫üá∏ Integrated Claims with Claim.MD
12 min read
Practice Plan
Thrive Plan
üí∏ Jane users get a
10% discount
on their monthly
Claim.MD subscription cost!
Not signed up with Claim.MD yet? Learn more about
how to get started
.
With Integrated Claims, you can connect your Claim.MD account to do the following‚Ä¶
Submit claims (837)
View claim acknowledgements and manage rejections (277)
Receive insurer remittances (835)
‚Ä¶all right inside your Jane account!
We‚Äôve been making some updates to make insurance billing simpler. Check out
what‚Äôs new
and see how our Claim.MD integration can help you manage your entire revenue cycle in Jane.
Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find in this guide:
How to connect Claim.MD with Jane for claim submissions
Submitting claims
Claim acknowledgements and managing rejections
Receiving insurer remittances
Billing Community
FAQs
Watch the webinar
How to connect Claim.MD with Jane for claim submissions
In your Claim.MD account
Before connecting your Claim.MD account with Jane, you‚Äôll need to log in to Claim.MD and adjust a couple of settings. Choose
Settings
from the list on the left and then click the
Account Settings
tab at the top of the page.
Start by setting the
SFTP Active
field to
Yes
.
‚ÄºÔ∏è¬†While on this screen, note down your SFTP Username and Password. The password is
only visible once
in Claim.MD, so be sure to note down your password
before leaving this page
.
Some other key settings to check:
Claim Status Format
should be
277
Receive ERA/835
should be
835
Transmit Approval Required
should be
unchecked
(if it‚Äôs on, you‚Äôll have to log in to Claim.MD to approve all claims submitted through the integration)
To disable transmit approval setting within Claim.MD, you‚Äôll want to head over to
Settings
and click on the
Account Settings
tab at the top. Then uncheck the
Transmit Approval Required
option.
These settings will ensure that Jane automatically sends claims to Claim.MD and that Claim.MD automatically sends claim acknowledgments (like Rejections) and
ERAs
back to Jane.
Last but not least, look for your Vendor Settings and check that you can see Jane listed as a Vendor. If you don‚Äôt see Jane listed, you‚Äôll want to reach out to Claim.MD to let them know. Without this, they won‚Äôt know to apply the discount.
In your Jane account
Now that you have your Claim.MD SFTP username and password, you can connect your Claim.MD account with Jane in
Settings > Integrations > Clearinghouse
.
Next, enter your Claim.MD SFTP username and SFTP password ‚Äî the username and password that you noted down when enabling SFTP in your Claim.MD account.
Note that your SFTP login credentials are different than the username and password you use to login to your Claim.MD account.
And that‚Äôs all! You‚Äôre ready to start billing through Integrated Claims with Claim.MD!
üîù
Back to table of contents
Submitting Claims
If you‚Äôve been
submitting claims electronically
through Jane, this will feel pretty familiar (minus a few steps üòâ).
After selecting a batch of claims, simply click the Submit button in the submission preview. When you press this button, Jane will generate a batch submission and automatically send it to your Claim.MD account.
Your claims will appear in your Claim.MD within 10 minutes of generating a submission.
Once you‚Äôve submitted your claims, they‚Äôll sit in the Submitted folder awaiting
claim acknowledgements
from Claim.MD and insurance companies.
üîù
Back to table of contents
Claim acknowledgements and managing rejections
Let‚Äôs start with
what
claim acknowledgements are, and why they‚Äôre important in the billing process.
Clearinghouses and insurers send claim acknowledgements to let you know they have
received
your claims. A claim acknowledgement confirms whether a claim has made it through to the next billing ‚Äòstage‚Äô (i.e. adjudication by the payer), or if you need to fix your claim and resubmit (i.e. a rejection for invalid information).
In Jane, claim acknowledgements are displayed in the Claim Summary panel, which can be accessed when viewing a claim in your claim submission folders.
If a claim gets rejected by Claim.MD or the insurance company, Jane will automatically move it to the Rejected folder.
From there, you can view the rejection reason in the claim summary panel. You can click the toggle to see the detailed rejection reason.
Once you address the rejection reason, you can mark the claim as unsubmitted in Jane, and resubmit it through the integration.
üîù
Back to table of contents
Receiving insurer remittances
Jane checks for new electronic remittances (835) in your Claim.MD account¬†every few hours.
When you‚Äôve been sent a new ERA, Claim.MD will automatically upload it to your Jane account so you can post the payment. If you‚Äôre new to posting ERA payments in Jane, check out
this handy guide.
The ‚Äòcount‚Äô next to your Remittances folder (Billing > Remittances) keeps track of all ERAs that need your attention. When that count begins to climb, you‚Äôll know you‚Äôre receiving new ERAs through the integration!
üîù
Back to table of contents
Billing Community
Jane‚Äôs
US Billing Community
is for our current customers and has members with lots of experience with our Integrated Claims with Claim.MD.ü§© 
Even better? You‚Äôll have access to third-party billers who can help answer questions, provide tips, best practices, and more. üíô
üîù
Back to table of contents
FAQs
‚≠êÔ∏èCan I connect one Claim.MD account to multiple Jane accounts? Or multiple Claim.MD accounts to one Jane account?
No
, right now you can only connect one Jane account with one Claim.MD account. Trying to connect a single Claim.MD account to multiple Jane accounts will result in all of the ERAs from the Claim.MD account being sent to all connected accounts, which could be a HIPAA violation.
‚≠êÔ∏èWill Jane upload ERAs that were uploaded to my Claim.MD before I set up my integration?
When you connect your Claim.MD account with Jane, Claim.MD will automatically send all
new
remits to your Jane account. That said, any remittance that you received
before
you set up your integration will not be sent to your Jane account.
If you have any old remittances in Claim.MD that aren‚Äôt in Jane yet, head to the View ERA section of Claim.MD, select those old ERAs, and select the
Send to SFTP Server
option.
Don‚Äôt worry if you accidentally select an ERA that‚Äôs already in your Jane account. Jane will catch and ignore any duplicates!
‚≠êÔ∏èHow often does Jane check for new electronic remittances (835)? How long does it take Jane to send Claims to Claim.MD?
Jane checks for new electronic remittances (835) in your Claim.MD account¬†every few hours. That means that you could see a new remittance within your Claim.MD account that hasn‚Äôt yet been uploaded to Jane. But if that happens, there‚Äôs no need to worry! Jane will upload that remittance in the next few hours.
Once you submit a batch of claims, Jane will upload them to Claim.MD within 10 minutes.
‚≠êÔ∏èHow can I tell if an ERA in my Claim.MD account has been uploaded to Jane?
If you‚Äôre unsure if an ERA has been uploaded to Jane, you can head to the¬†View ERA¬†section of your Claim.MD account and look for the
STFP Download
icon. If you see the icon (shown in the screenshot below), that means the ERA has already been uploaded to your Jane account.
‚≠êÔ∏èIf I fix & submit a rejected claim in Claim.MD, do I need to manually update that claim in Jane too?
If you fix the rejection directly in Claim.MD, all you need to do is give Jane a little time, and the claim 
will ü™Ñautomagicallyü™Ñ move from the Rejected folder to the Submitted folder.
Behind the scenes, Claim.MD will send a ‚Äòsuccessful‚Äô claim acknowledgement to Jane. When Jane sees that, we bump the claim over to Submitted.
It can take an hour or so after fixing the rejection for this to happen, so if you‚Äôre impatient (or just really want to see that updated right away!), you can manually move that claim to the Submitted folder.
‚≠êÔ∏èAm I able to submit and process Workers Comp Claims with the Claim.MD integration?
Yes
, as long as the payer has an
Electronic Payer ID
. You‚Äôll want to ensure to check the
Transmit Approval Required
to attach treatment notes to these claims.
This setting will hold claims so you can head over to Claim.MD and attach any relevant and required documentation. Next, had over to
Manage Claims
within the left sidebar menu. Those claims will now be listed as
Pending Approval
, and you‚Äôll want to click on the
View Claim
button to the right.
From here, you can click on the claim you‚Äôll be able to click on the blue
Attach Documents
text at the top of the page.
Lastly, click on the
Save Claim
button in the top right corner and approve transmit. For more details on this process, you can check out our guide on
How to Attach Supporting Documents to Claims in Claim.MD
.
‚≠êÔ∏èWhy did you integrate with Claim.MD?
We chose to integrate with Claim.MD for a few reasons‚Ä¶
Our community loves billing with Jane and Claim.MD. Jane users who switched to Claim.MD have told us:
- It provides a smoother and more likely-to-succeed billing process than their previous clearinghouse
- Claim.MD is intuitive and easy to navigate
Claim.MD has helper-first values that align with ours:
- They focus on customer experience and provide good customer support
- They‚Äôre willing to add new payers
- They have transparent, no-surprises
pricing
Working with Claim.MD allows us to build a better integration, faster:
- They have resources that allow us to build our own integration, which creates a more intuitive, cohesive billing experience for Jane users
‚≠êÔ∏èWill you be integrating with Office Ally, Availity, and/or TriZetto?
We don‚Äôt have any plans to build integrations with additional clearinghouses at the moment. The more integrations we build, the longer it will take for us to add more value to the insurance billing experience (things like eligibility checks), so we‚Äôre focussing on building one great billing experience with Claim.MD right now.
‚≠êÔ∏èI‚Äôm not using Claim.MD right now. Should I switch?
We think so! For all the reasons listed above, we believe Claim.MD is a great choice for Jane users. You will need to be using Claim.MD in order to enjoy our Integrated Claims feature, so if that‚Äôs something that will make your billing a lot easier (and we think it will üòâ), it‚Äôs worth making the switch.
üîù
Back to table of contents
Watch the webinar
In this 25-minute session, you‚Äôll see a demo of Claim.MD, an overview of billing through the integration in Jane, some stats from our beta users, and what we‚Äôll be building next. Enjoy! üçø
Subscribe to our monthly newsletter.

With Integrated Claims, you can connect your Claim.MD account to do the following‚Ä¶
Submit claims (837)
View claim acknowledgements and manage rejections (277)
Receive insurer remittances (835)
‚Ä¶all right inside your Jane account!
We‚Äôve been making some updates to make insurance billing simpler. Check out
what‚Äôs new
and see how our Claim.MD integration can help you manage your entire revenue cycle in Jane.
Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find in this guide:
How to connect Claim.MD with Jane for claim submissions

Receiving insurer remittances

FAQs

How to connect Claim.MD with Jane for claim submissions
In your Claim.MD account
Before connecting your Claim.MD account with Jane, you‚Äôll need to log in to Claim.MD and adjust a couple of settings. Choose
Settings
from the list on the left and then click the
Account Settings
tab at the top of the page.
Start by setting the
SFTP Active
field to
Yes
.
‚ÄºÔ∏è¬†While on this screen, note down your SFTP Username and Password. The password is
only visible once
in Claim.MD, so be sure to note down your password
before leaving this page
.
Some other key settings to check:
Claim Status Format
should be
277
Receive ERA/835
should be
835
Transmit Approval Required
should be
unchecked
(if it‚Äôs on, you‚Äôll have to log in to Claim.MD to approve all claims submitted through the integration)
To disable transmit approval setting within Claim.MD, you‚Äôll want to head over to
Settings
and click on the
Account Settings
tab at the top. Then uncheck the
Transmit Approval Required
option.
These settings will ensure that Jane automatically sends claims to Claim.MD and that Claim.MD automatically sends claim acknowledgments (like Rejections) and
ERAs
back to Jane.
Last but not least, look for your Vendor Settings and check that you can see Jane listed as a Vendor. If you don‚Äôt see Jane listed, you‚Äôll want to reach out to Claim.MD to let them know. Without this, they won‚Äôt know to apply the discount.
In your Jane account
Now that you have your Claim.MD SFTP username and password, you can connect your Claim.MD account with Jane in
Settings > Integrations > Clearinghouse
.
Next, enter your Claim.MD SFTP username and SFTP password ‚Äî the username and password that you noted down when enabling SFTP in your Claim.MD account.
Note that your SFTP login credentials are different than the username and password you use to login to your Claim.MD account.
And that‚Äôs all! You‚Äôre ready to start billing through Integrated Claims with Claim.MD!
üîù
Back to table of contents
Submitting Claims
If you‚Äôve been
submitting claims electronically
through Jane, this will feel pretty familiar (minus a few steps üòâ).
After selecting a batch of claims, simply click the Submit button in the submission preview. When you press this button, Jane will generate a batch submission and automatically send it to your Claim.MD account.
Your claims will appear in your Claim.MD within 10 minutes of generating a submission.
Once you‚Äôve submitted your claims, they‚Äôll sit in the Submitted folder awaiting
claim acknowledgements
from Claim.MD and insurance companies.
üîù
Back to table of contents
Claim acknowledgements and managing rejections
Let‚Äôs start with
what
claim acknowledgements are, and why they‚Äôre important in the billing process.
Clearinghouses and insurers send claim acknowledgements to let you know they have
received
your claims. A claim acknowledgement confirms whether a claim has made it through to the next billing ‚Äòstage‚Äô (i.e. adjudication by the payer), or if you need to fix your claim and resubmit (i.e. a rejection for invalid information).
In Jane, claim acknowledgements are displayed in the Claim Summary panel, which can be accessed when viewing a claim in your claim submission folders.
If a claim gets rejected by Claim.MD or the insurance company, Jane will automatically move it to the Rejected folder.
From there, you can view the rejection reason in the claim summary panel. You can click the toggle to see the detailed rejection reason.
Once you address the rejection reason, you can mark the claim as unsubmitted in Jane, and resubmit it through the integration.
üîù
Back to table of contents
Receiving insurer remittances
Jane checks for new electronic remittances (835) in your Claim.MD account¬†every few hours.
When you‚Äôve been sent a new ERA, Claim.MD will automatically upload it to your Jane account so you can post the payment. If you‚Äôre new to posting ERA payments in Jane, check out
this handy guide.
The ‚Äòcount‚Äô next to your Remittances folder (Billing > Remittances) keeps track of all ERAs that need your attention. When that count begins to climb, you‚Äôll know you‚Äôre receiving new ERAs through the integration!
üîù

FAQs
‚≠êÔ∏èCan I connect one Claim.MD account to multiple Jane accounts? Or multiple Claim.MD accounts to one Jane account?
No
, right now you can only connect one Jane account with one Claim.MD account. Trying to connect a single Claim.MD account to multiple Jane accounts will result in all of the ERAs from the Claim.MD account being sent to all connected accounts, which could be a HIPAA violation.
‚≠êÔ∏èWill Jane upload ERAs that were uploaded to my Claim.MD before I set up my integration?
When you connect your Claim.MD account with Jane, Claim.MD will automatically send all
new
remits to your Jane account. That said, any remittance that you received
before
you set up your integration will not be sent to your Jane account.
If you have any old remittances in Claim.MD that aren‚Äôt in Jane yet, head to the View ERA section of Claim.MD, select those old ERAs, and select the
Send to SFTP Server
option.
Don‚Äôt worry if you accidentally select an ERA that‚Äôs already in your Jane account. Jane will catch and ignore any duplicates!
‚≠êÔ∏èHow often does Jane check for new electronic remittances (835)? How long does it take Jane to send Claims to Claim.MD?
Jane checks for new electronic remittances (835) in your Claim.MD account¬†every few hours. That means that you could see a new remittance within your Claim.MD account that hasn‚Äôt yet been uploaded to Jane. But if that happens, there‚Äôs no need to worry! Jane will upload that remittance in the next few hours.
Once you submit a batch of claims, Jane will upload them to Claim.MD within 10 minutes.
‚≠êÔ∏èHow can I tell if an ERA in my Claim.MD account has been uploaded to Jane?
If you‚Äôre unsure if an ERA has been uploaded to Jane, you can head to the¬†View ERA¬†section of your Claim.MD account and look for the
STFP Download
icon. If you see the icon (shown in the screenshot below), that means the ERA has already been uploaded to your Jane account.
‚≠êÔ∏èIf I fix & submit a rejected claim in Claim.MD, do I need to manually update that claim in Jane too?
If you fix the rejection directly in Claim.MD, all you need to do is give Jane a little time, and the claim 
will ü™Ñautomagicallyü™Ñ move from the Rejected folder to the Submitted folder.
Behind the scenes, Claim.MD will send a ‚Äòsuccessful‚Äô claim acknowledgement to Jane. When Jane sees that, we bump the claim over to Submitted.
It can take an hour or so after fixing the rejection for this to happen, so if you‚Äôre impatient (or just really want to see that updated right away!), you can manually move that claim to the Submitted folder.
‚≠êÔ∏èAm I able to submit and process Workers Comp Claims with the Claim.MD integration?
Yes
, as long as the payer has an
Electronic Payer ID
. You‚Äôll want to ensure to check the
Transmit Approval Required
to attach treatment notes to these claims.
This setting will hold claims so you can head over to Claim.MD and attach any relevant and required documentation. Next, had over to
Manage Claims
within the left sidebar menu. Those claims will now be listed as
Pending Approval
, and you‚Äôll want to click on the
View Claim
button to the right.
From here, you can click on the claim you‚Äôll be able to click on the blue
Attach Documents
text at the top of the page.
Lastly, click on the
Save Claim
button in the top right corner and approve transmit. For more details on this process, you can check out our guide on
How to Attach Supporting Documents to Claims in Claim.MD
.
‚≠êÔ∏èWhy did you integrate with Claim.MD?
We chose to integrate with Claim.MD for a few reasons‚Ä¶
Our community loves billing with Jane and Claim.MD. Jane users who switched to Claim.MD have told us:
- It provides a smoother and more likely-to-succeed billing process than their previous clearinghouse
- Claim.MD is intuitive and easy to navigate
Claim.MD has helper-first values that align with ours:
- They focus on customer experience and provide good customer support
- They‚Äôre willing to add new payers
- They have transparent, no-surprises
pricing
Working with Claim.MD allows us to build a better integration, faster:
- They have resources that allow us to build our own integration, which creates a more intuitive, cohesive billing experience for Jane users
‚≠êÔ∏èWill you be integrating with Office Ally, Availity, and/or TriZetto?
We don‚Äôt have any plans to build integrations with additional clearinghouses at the moment. The more integrations we build, the longer it will take for us to add more value to the insurance billing experience (things like eligibility checks), so we‚Äôre focussing on building one great billing experience with Claim.MD right now.
‚≠êÔ∏èI‚Äôm not using Claim.MD right now. Should I switch?
We think so! For all the reasons listed above, we believe Claim.MD is a great choice for Jane users. You will need to be using Claim.MD in order to enjoy our Integrated Claims feature, so if that‚Äôs something that will make your billing a lot easier (and we think it will üòâ), it‚Äôs worth making the switch.
